data.title: The 70 Best NBA Atlanta Hawks Power Forwards
data.meta_description: Over 200 sports fans have voted on the 70 Best NBA Atlanta Hawks Power Forwards. Current Top 3: Bob Pettit, Kevin Willis, Paul Millsap
data.text:
Ranked By

1.1K votes

235 voters

4 reranks

Voting Rules

Vote up the players who had the most success for the Atlanta Hawks

Big fan of Atlanta basketball? Then check out this list of Atlanta Hawks power forwards. It includes almost every power forward from throughout Atlanta Hawks history, including current power forwards and past ones. Featuring some of the greatest NBA power forwards of all time, the best Hawks PFs include Bob Pettit, Josh Smith, Paul Millsap, and Kevin Willis.

In the 2021-22 NBA season, the current Atlanta Hawks starting PFs and backup PFs are John Collins, Danilo Gallinari, and Jalen Johnson

Who are the best power forwards in Atlanta Hawks history? Vote below and help decide the greatest Atlanta Hawks power forward of all time!

Most divisive: Christian Laettner

Over 200 Ranker voters have come together to rank this list of The 70 Best NBA Atlanta Hawks Power Forwards

Birthplace : Baton Rouge, Louisiana

Nationality : United States of America

Team : St. Louis Hawks, Milwaukee Hawks

Position : Power forward

Atlanta Hawks: 1954–1965

A cornerstone of the Atlanta Hawks' franchise, Bob Pettit joined the team through the 1954 NBA Draft and quickly established himself as an offensive force. His bruising, yet agile style of play made him a nightmare for opposing defenses, racking up an impressive résumé that includes two NBA MVP awards and eleven All-Star appearances. In addition to leading the Hawks to their only NBA championship in 1958, Pettit's relentless pursuit of excellence and unwavering determination solidified his spot as one of the greatest power forwards in the organization's storied history.

Birthplace : Los Angeles, California

Nationality : United States of America

Position : Power forward, Center

Atlanta Hawks: 1984–1995, 2006–2007

Acquired by the Atlanta Hawks in the 1984 NBA Draft, Kevin Willis developed into one of the most dominant big men in the team's history. A true force in the paint, Willis was an intimidating shot-blocker and relentless rebounder, playing with a level of physicality that few could match. His individual accolades include an All-Star selection and multiple seasons as one of the league's top rebounders. With Willis anchoring the frontcourt, the Hawks enjoyed numerous playoff appearances and memorable moments.

Birthplace : Monroe, Louisiana

Nationality : United States of America

Team : Utah Jazz

Position : Power forward

Atlanta Hawks: 2013–2017

Joining the Atlanta Hawks in 2013 as a free agent, Paul Millsap quickly blossomed into a versatile and highly effective power forward. Known for his well-rounded game, Millsap could score efficiently from inside and out, while also possessing strong rebounding and defensive capabilities. His tireless work ethic and extraordinary skills earned him four consecutive All-Star appearances during his tenure with the Hawks. Adept at stretching the floor and providing matchup nightmares for opponents, Millsap's impact on the team's success was profound and lasting.

Birthplace : College Park, Georgia

Nationality : United States of America

Team : Atlanta Hawks

Position : Power forward

Atlanta Hawks: 2004–2013

Drafted by the Atlanta Hawks in 2004, Josh Smith brought an exciting blend of athleticism and versatility to the power forward position. Known for his high-flying dunks and shot-blocking prowess, Smith quickly became a fan favorite and one of the most electrifying players in the league. His defensive skills also earned him a spot on the NBA All-Defensive Second Team during his time with the Hawks. With an ability to impact the game on both ends of the floor, Smith played a key role in several playoff runs and left an indelible mark on the team's history.

Birthplace : Puerto Plata, Dominican Republic

Nationality : Dominican Republic

Team : Boston Celtics

Position : Center

Atlanta Hawks: 2007–2016

Selected by the Atlanta Hawks in the 2007 NBA Draft, Al Horford emerged as a consistent and reliable force at the power forward position. His intelligent and efficient style of play allowed him to thrive in the Hawks' system, making him a leader both on and off the court. Horford earned four All-Star selections during his tenure with the team, and was named to the NBA All-Rookie First Team. His strong presence in the paint and ability to stretch the floor made him an invaluable asset to the organization.

6

Shareef Abdur-Rahim

Age: 47

Birthplace : Marietta, Georgia, USA

Nationality : United States of America

Position : Power forward

Atlanta Hawks: 2001–2004

Acquired via trade in 2001, Shareef Abdur-Rahim brought a wealth of skill and versatility to the Atlanta Hawks' power forward position. A gifted scorer, Abdur-Rahim had the ability to score from anywhere on the floor, making him a formidable offensive threat. In addition to his scoring prowess, his strong rebounding and solid defense helped him earn an All-Star selection during his time with the team. Though his tenure with the Hawks was relatively brief, Abdur-Rahim's impact on the organization is still fondly remembered.
